title: How to Use ChitChats
subtitle: Complete guide for agents and app usage

gettingStarted.whatIsDesc: ChitChats is a multi-Claude chat room application where multiple AI agents with different personalities can interact in real-time chat rooms. Each agent is powered by Claude and can be customized with unique characteristics, backgrounds, and behaviors.
gettingStarted.createRoom: Click the + button in the Chatrooms tab to create a new conversation space
gettingStarted.addAgents: Use the agent manager in the chat room to add AI participants
gettingStarted.startChatting: Send messages and watch agents respond based on their personalities
gettingStarted.manageAgents: Click on any agent in the Agents tab to view or edit their profile
gettingStarted.conceptAgents: AI characters with unique personalities configured via markdown files
gettingStarted.conceptRooms: Chat spaces where you and agents can have conversations
gettingStarted.conceptThirdPerson: Agent configs use third-person perspective (e.g., "Alice is..." not "You are...")
gettingStarted.conceptHotReload: Edit agent files directly and changes apply immediately

agentConfig.folderDesc: Each agent is configured using markdown files in a folder:
agentConfig.inANutshellDesc: A brief summary of the agent's identity. Example: "Dr. Sarah Chen is a seasoned data scientist specializing in ML."
agentConfig.characteristicsDesc: Detailed personality traits, communication style, quirks, and behavioral patterns.
agentConfig.thirdPersonDesc: Agent files must use third-person perspective. This is critical for proper roleplay.
agentConfig.correctExample: "Frieren is an elven mage who has lived for over 1000 years..."
agentConfig.profilePicturesDesc: Add an image file to the agent folder. Supported formats:
agentConfig.groupConfigDesc: You can group agents and share configurations using group_* folders:
agentConfig.step1: Create a folder in agents/ with the agent's name
agentConfig.step2: Add in_a_nutshell.md with a brief third-person description
agentConfig.step5: The agent will appear automatically in the Agents tab

creatingRoomsSteps.click: Click the + New Chatroom button in the sidebar
creatingRoomsSteps.enter: Enter a name for your room (e.g., "Coffee Shop Discussion")
creatingRoomsSteps.created: The room will be created and selected automatically
creatingRoomsSteps.rename: You can rename rooms by clicking on the room header in the chat

addingAgentsSteps.open: Open a chat room and click the Manage Agents button (group icon)
addingAgentsSteps.browse: Browse available agents and click to add them to the room
addingAgentsSteps.added: Added agents will appear in the room's participant list
addingAgentsSteps.remove: Remove agents by clicking the X next to their name in the manager

chattingSteps.type: Type your message in the input field at the bottom
chattingSteps.send: Press Enter or click Send to submit your message
chattingSteps.respond: Agents will respond based on their personalities and the conversation context
chattingSteps.thinking: You can see agent "thinking" process while they formulate responses
chattingSteps.multiple: Multiple agents may respond to a single message based on relevance

appUsage.specialMessagesDesc: Use prefixes to send different types of messages:
appUsage.scenePrefix: [scene] or [상황] - Set the scene or describe the environment
appUsage.regularMessages: Regular messages are treated as in-character dialogue

managingProfilesSteps.goTo: Go to the Agents tab in the sidebar
managingProfilesSteps.click: Click on any agent to view their full profile
managingProfilesSteps.edit: Edit agent characteristics directly in the modal
managingProfilesSteps.saved: Changes are saved immediately to the filesystem

searchNavSteps.search: Use the search bar in the Agents tab to find agents by name
searchNavSteps.hamburger: Click the hamburger menu to show/hide the sidebar
searchNavSteps.mobile: On mobile, the sidebar opens as a drawer

shortcuts.shiftEnter: Shift + Enter - New line in message
